title:
Electron-overdoped Ag(II)F2: mixed-valence fluorides Ag(I)Ag(II)F3 and
  Ag(I)2Ag(II)F4
authors: Katarzyna Kuder, Kacper Koteras, Zoran Mazej and Wojciech Grochala
abstract:
We have successfully prepared two novel mixed-valence compounds of silver,
Ag(I)Ag(II)F3 and Ag(I)2Ag(II)F4. They may be considered to be long-sought
strongly electron-overdoped Ag(II)F2. Their crystal structures indicate that
both belong to the Class I (mixed-valence) family with frozen Ag(I) and Ag(II)
valences. The measured Raman spectra are well-correlated with the theoretical
ones. Density functional theory calculations reveal their smaller fundamental
band gaps as compared to pristine AgF2, due to the presence of Ag(I) states in
the valence band.
